item.title: JavaBean Standards in Java
item.description: Today lets talk about Javabean Standards. JavaBeans are Java classes that have properties. For our purposes, think of properties as private instance variables. Since they’re private, the only way they can be accessed from outside of their class is through methods in the class. The methods that change a property’s value are called setter methods, and the methods that retrieve a property’s value are called getter methods.
